newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt says seeks 50,000 t U.S. wheat by Saturday.
newsitem.headline: Egypt says seeks 50,000 t U.S. wheat by Saturday.

text.p: Egypt said on Friday that it wanted to buy 50,000 tonnes of U.S. wheat for shipment in September or October, buyer's option. The deadline for bids is 1000 local (0700 GMT) on Saturday, August 24.
Samir Shakankiri, vice chairman of the state's General Authority for Supply Commodities, told Reuters the wheat could be U.S. hard red, U.S. soft white, Western or U.S. soft red.
The authority will announce a result by 1600 (1300 GMT), Shakankiri said.
He said Egypt wanted to compare U.S. prices with those it receives for French wheat in a tender also set for Saturday.
